alert.note: Alert for Sawtooth, Stanley Basin; Sun Valley Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 4:44PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact the Ross Fork burn scar in southwestern Custer and northwestern Blaine Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 438 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Galena Lodge, or 23 miles northwest of Ketchum, moving north at 35 mph. Additional thunderstorms to the south will also track north across the burn scar. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph and locally heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Rainfall from these repeated thunderstorms could lead to minor flooding issues from runoff. Locations impacted include... Galena Summit and Smiley Creek Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding near the Ross Fork burn scar. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Sawtooth, Stanley Basin; Sun Valley Region
